storyInfo: Things take an unexpected turn as sinister red clouds above the Shard cover the entire battlefield. Meanwhile, Manfred prepares to reclaim the Lifebone.

attributes.content: Thirty minutes earlier...
Underground structure, Highbury Borough, Londinium
You're back. How are things up top?
attributes.name: Londinium Worker A

attributes.content: Same as ever. Maybe worse.
attributes.name: Londinium Worker B

attributes.content: I used to be scared of those devil mercenaries who ask you for a smoke. The worst you'll get is a slap on the face if they feel like it.
attributes.name: Londinium Worker B

attributes.content: But now? It's all monsters you can't even describe that'll turn you into a puddle of blood without so much as blinking.
attributes.name: Londinium Worker B

attributes.content: You know what? I've been sleeping better. Because I know there's nothing but death if I run into one of them.
attributes.name: Londinium Worker B

attributes.content: Are the Sarkaz still grabbing workers off the streets?
attributes.name: Londinium Worker A

attributes.content: Didn't see anything. We didn't dare go too far. Doesn't seem like the Sarkaz are interested in running the city anymore. There's no one maintaining public order.
attributes.name: Londinium Worker B

attributes.content: They couldn't fully occupy Londinium, could they? What use is it to them? Are they really planning to drive the Victorian capital all the way back to Kazdel?
attributes.name: Londinium Worker B

attributes.content: Who knows? Honestly, I haven't a clue what they're trying to do. Why go through so much trouble if they just want to kill everyone?
attributes.name: Londinium Worker A

attributes.content: How sad. Those who betrayed their friends for a better future are soon betrayed by the better future.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: No one expected things to turn out like this. You know we didn't mean to...
attributes.name: Londinium Worker A

attributes.content: Let me guess—you mean us no harm but handed us to the Defense Forces out of fear. How kind and gentle. You all deserve a medal.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Catherine, we...
attributes.name: Londinium Worker B

attributes.content: Save it. I don't have time to dig up old grudges, not that it would help anything anyway. At least you didn't gift wrap my head and Feist's and give them to the Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: The question is, what do we do now?
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: We can hide here. We know the underground passages better than the Sarkaz—
attributes.name: Londinium Worker A

attributes.content: That's your plan, Tommy? Live underground for the rest of your life like a talpibeast? Why don't you just go hide in a coffin, then?
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: I don't blame you for what you did. Given a choice, no one wants to go to war. But war is here now, right here in our homes.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: There's nowhere to run.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: I ran into a few fellows who said they could get us some decent weapons. I reckon—
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Is that thunder?
attributes.name: Londinium Worker A

attributes.content: Rain would be really nice right now.
attributes.name: Londinium Worker B

attributes.content: Why is it shaking? Is Londinium on the move?
attributes.name: Londinium Worker A

attributes.content: But the mobility level is—
attributes.name: Londinium Worker A

attributes.content: Something's not right.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Let's head up and see what's happening. Be careful.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: What is it, Catherine? You're blocking the window.
attributes.name: Londinium Worker A

attributes.content: The massive silhouette of The Shard is just visible from here.
The most familiar sight and the pride of all who call Londinium home.
But the annoying yet comforting blankets of clouds above are nowhere to be seen.
Wait... What's that on top of the Shard?
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Take all our supplies and contact everyone we can. We need to move deeper underground now!
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Hurry!
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Fifteen minutes earlier...
Silverrock Bluffs, Londinium Outskirts
We're approaching Silverrock Bluffs... That means the attacks will start soon.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: When I first heard Wellington's plan a few days ago...
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Do you know what my initial reaction was?
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: You thought it was too ambitious, your Grace?
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: Ambitious? I think you mean crazy.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Yes... crazy. He wants the entire allied forces committed to the front lines — thirteen dreadnoughts, forty-five assault ships, one hundred seventy-two gunboats...
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: Eighty-six transports, ten support ships, all our artillery, and one hundred eighty thousand infantry, including the entire reserves.
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: It wasn't an inquiry or request. It was a notice, almost an order.
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: The Duke of Wellington has also abandoned the traditional Gaulish formation of multiple battle lines, instead having all fleets form single files to penetrate the Nachzehrer line all at once.
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: Gododdin and our forces are to be responsible for fire support and clearing out casters in the Sarkaz rear, while Wellington's vanguard charges at the center of the Nachzehrer formation.
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: The Silverrock Bluffs, currently under Sarkaz control, is a key pass between the Redmane Mountains and the Duskglow River, and a highly defensible position.
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: The enemy can easily retreat towards Londinium, even if we win the battle.
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: I would have staunchly opposed the plan, if it was not Wellington who proposed it.
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: But you and the rest of the high commanders eventually consented to it.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: We've seen similar tactics in the military academies. They were the same tactics used in that legendary battle of the War of the Four Nations, in which Duke Wellington fought.
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: The Victoria and Leithanien alliance split the Gaulish lines into three and quashed their resistance.
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: That battle put Victorian on a new course for the next several decades.
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: Glorious as it may be, the past is no place to find refuge in.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Do you also think the Iron Duke has grown old?
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: Wellington is a military genius.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: He commands battleships with the same ease and grace as a Leithanian virtuoso. I have never seen anyone quite like him.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: He is not one of those fools blindly chasing the glory of the past.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: The Sarkaz is not the end, but merely the beginning of the end of the real battle.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: As for here and now...
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: It's not just Wellington who needs a decisive victory.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: The Sarkaz have the Shard, and they have successfully fired it before. They could attack us or anywhere in Victoria at any moment.
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: However, our war scholars deem any losses from Sarkaz Catastrophe attacks to be within acceptable limits.
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: Those losses will not compromise our ability to achieve our strategic objective.
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: The Sarkaz have not refueled Londinium since it deviated from course. The city is immobile as of now.
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: Once we take the pass at Silverrock Bluffs, the Sarkaz will no longer have a terrain advantage, and the allied fleets will have a clear path to Londinium.
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: Indeed, if everything goes well–
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: We will be able to end this meaningless stalemate as quickly as possible.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Yet the word 'stalemate' isn't an apt description for the Sarkaz and Victoria.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Telegrams from the Caster hold are increasingly impatient. One cannot fault our backers for it. War is far too expensive.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: A promise fulfilled too late is a promise unfulfilled.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Are those the cannons of Gastrell going off?
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: The Duke of Wellington's attack has begun? But it's not time yet.
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: Your Grace, what's that red light coming from the distance?
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: That light! It's coming from the top of the Shard!
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: Hail Wellington right now! We must—
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Doctor! Are you okay?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: The Doctor will be fine. Mon3tr absorbed the brunt of the impact.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: Where are we?;How are the others?

attributes.content: The good news is that we fell into a canyon. Our precise location is uncertain, but we're at least a distance from the worst of the fighting.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Closure, Horn, and Siege have gone out to scout our surroundings. You should be briefed on the specifics soon.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: We're still assessing our personnel and equipment losses. Preliminary reports indicate that pre-impact measures were effective and losses are acceptable. Medical and engineering units are already at work.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I'm afraid there's been some troubling development.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Watch your step and keep up with us, Doctor.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Suffering extends its reach to every corner the eye can see.
From the top of the Shard, Originium spreads like a plague, devouring... assimilating.
Buildings, ships, armies... Originium devours all and quickly expands.
An unprecedented calamity indeed, one that puts even the most terrifying Catastrophes to shame.
And yet, an army marches through the roiling Originium crystals, its tattered banner visible even from here.
Suffering is but a marching order for the Sarkaz.
The ever-hungry procession of Sarkaz advances to the horns of wailing...
Sinking their teeth and claws into any enemy they find.
Blood-stained boulders litter the wasteland as far as the eye can see, looking decidedly out of place.
The whipping winds have ceased, giving way to a rising fog.
The withered grass remains unstirred, yet countless tattered bandages already dangle across.
Sarkaz warriors stand in line, soundless and motionless.
Waiting for the embodiment of death and decay, the master of war, their king.
A withered figure emerges from the death-filled fog.

attributes.text: Out of the fog, he glides, through wind and sand, rising from the withered grass.
And upon the Arts ritual circle he descends.
Tattered stripes of cloth fall to the blood-filled columns, like a bony hand caressing a tombstone.
Only the most seasoned warriors recognize that the Nachzehrer's tattered ribbons, like the banners on Kazdel's walls, belong to generations of ancient Sarkaz tribes.
Their form ragged, their symbols recognizable, but their scent of war unmistakable.

attributes.content: Duq'arael, Regent's Crimson, Prince of Blood.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: We were never close.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: But the contribution that you and your blood made to the war is undeniable.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: I bear witness to your glory and shame.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Slayer of the Feranmut in the Mist, Jailer of Time.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Usurper of the Royal Court, Executioner of Kings.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: You denied the path that we now walk, as you've denied the meaning of the Black Crown—
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: But you gave your first and final drop of blood to the Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Your power shall not fade away, nor shall your anger, your hatred, your ambition.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: He spreads his arms wide.
A black fog of decay rises, swallowing every boulder.
Red fades into sand and dirt, vanishing into the mist.
The warriors do not speak, but the earth begins to rumble as ancient witchcraft spreads across the battlefield.

attributes.text: 'War, we nourish you with our best.'
'Their blood and bones at your behest'
'We are the living and the dead.'
A drop of blood forms at the tip of Nezzsalem's staff.
It is the purest blood, the only blood that death and decay cannot touch.

attributes.content: ...This is the Blood of Teekaz.
attributes.name: Salus

attributes.content: It evoked the call of Amnannam, but was lost in the battle's Arts Circles. The Confessarii searched seventy of them without finding it.
attributes.name: Salus

attributes.content: But Nezzsalem, Your Highness, you have found it for the Regent.
attributes.name: Salus

attributes.content: The drop of red liquid drifts toward Salus and enters her wrist.
Keep it safe, Confessarius.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Of course. I vow to protect it with all the strength of my bloodline... my life.
attributes.name: Salus

attributes.content: The Vampiric Arts Circles are still active...
attributes.name: Salus

attributes.content: What of the Sanguinarch of Vampires? The purest bloodline, the cruelest of the sovereigns, the pride of the Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Salus

attributes.content: Did he really die so easily? At the hands of the young Banshee and the rabbit?
attributes.name: Salus

attributes.content: He has not joined the myriad souls, but away has he drifted.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: What a shame to waste so much blood.
attributes.name: Salus

attributes.content: Meddler of bloodlines. Do not desecrate war and death with your flippant insolence.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Um...
attributes.name: Salus

attributes.content: Apologies, your Highness, I was merely lamenting the loss of the Sanguinarch.
attributes.name: Salus

attributes.content: Then keep his legacy safe.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: His blood will continue the fight with us.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Of that, I have no doubt, Sovereign of the Withered Court.
attributes.name: Salus

attributes.content: The Blood of Teekaz will fulfill its duty. If a mere tremble of Amnannam is enough to burn the heaven red and bring upheaval to the earth...
attributes.name: Salus

attributes.content: Then its final descent shall free our fate from the manipulation of Originium, as the myriad souls have so longed for.
attributes.name: Salus

attributes.content: Fate?
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: War will crush all obstacles beneath its heel, even fate.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: The Deadwood Throne rises, attended by innumerable war altars, casting a massive shadow on the battlefield.
Silent columns of warriors step into the strange Catastrophe, continuing their advance.
We will advance before the storm.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Both the living and the dead—
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: This war belongs to all Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: A new beginning.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Another quote from one of the sovereigns, general?
attributes.name: Young Officer

attributes.content: I was simply reminded of the furnace at the center of Kazdel.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Oh, the big one. I witnessed many feedings before I came to Londinium.
attributes.name: Young Officer

attributes.content: It is an honor for a fallen warrior to be fed into it, becoming the fire that propels our progress.
attributes.name: Young Officer

attributes.content: But it never seems to be sated. Small wonder. The flames of a revenant's rage only burn stronger.
attributes.name: Young Officer

attributes.content: Nadine... would you call the nomadic city by the name of Kazdel your home?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: What is the meaning behind the question, sir, when the final battle has already begun?
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: I was raised on the battlefields outside Kazdel. The black rocks and the bones of my fellow Nachzehrer are the only things buried beneath the city's walls and wheels.
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: Where is home, if not Kazdel?
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: Yes... What other answer could there be?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: The future is lined with uncertainties, but this much we know: this war ends where a new beginning emerges.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Have you made contact with Ulšulah?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: No. They were very thorough in mopping up Brentwood.
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: Just as you predicted, our casters have picked up the trail of the Feranmut skeleton's movement. They considered attacking Londinium... attacking The Shard directly.
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: I gave them a chance... far too many chances.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: There is no question that Major Ulšulah has been negligent in her duty. She had better have a good explanation... if she lives to explain.
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: Have you located the skeleton?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: We have a rough idea of its location, but it will take time to find it on this vast battlefield. Should I take a squad there personally?
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: No. I will.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: We will retake the Feranmut's spine, or destroy it. It must not fall into the wrong hands again.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: You're going yourself?
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: Those mercenaries have interfered too much. They must be eliminated.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Before that, though... we will finish the ritual.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Our Nachzehrer ritual? I didn't think you cared much for tradition.
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: Cyclops, Lich, Wendigo, Banshee... more and more have left.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: You've never seen these Royal Courts in Kazdel, have you, young Nachzehrer?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: I suppose not. Other than the Nachzehrer, it's mostly been Vampires. Not the best neighbors, but you start to miss their smell when you spend enough time in Londinium.
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: The blood of the fallen has returned to the earth.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: There will be no new Prince of the Crimson Court.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: How many sovereigns do the Sarkaz have left?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: 'Bzzzz—'
'Logistics to Command. We've encountered a Catastrophe near Sufrior Chasm.'
'At least, I think it's a Catastrophe... we're being drowned in a tide of Originium.'
'The ship has lost power. Weapon systems severely damaged... all systems inoperative!'
'Defense systems offline... no response from Arts unit... I repeat, all systems inoperative...'
'Enemy spotted! Taking heavy fire, mobile Arts device... *Bzzt*...'
'Data... automatic record...'
None of these messages made it out.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: The entire communications system is scrap. To think that so many have died to protect this little metal box...
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: ...I salute you.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Phew... that bow hurt. I shouldn't take my hat off...
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Our foe is unpredictable, aren't they? There's enough intel about The Shard to fill an entire building.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: But you and I must take the blame for our present circumstances.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: The man in a hat looks down at his counterpart.
The man on the ground lies motionless, buried to his chest in crystal-filled dirt. But the little box that he clutches in his left hand remains spotless.
The Trilby Asher pulls the rim of his fallen comrade's hat down, covering the face that no one knew to begin with.
It took a little more effort to retrieve the communicator, but war has made him a rather proficient undertaker.
Intel retrieved.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Communications are still being jammed by severe interference.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: A little progress is better than nothing, I suppose.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: 'The Duke of Fife and the Sixth Infantry Battalion were ambushed. The landing attempt on the Crumley plate has failed.'
'Unable to reach the Duke of Gododdin's scout fleet. Chetleigh has been lost.'
'Large-scale unanticipated geological changes across the Silverrock Bluffs front. Active Originium concentration above threshold.'
No good news.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Are those... troops?
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: The ID code is—
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: My, my... what a miracle. I am a lucky man indeed.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'
